summary.p: Recommends, at the request of Amerbach and others, a talented boy from Zurich [Heinrich Hindermann], as he can no longer stay with his stepparents.

div.p: Greetings. I beseech you, my dear Bullinger, that you do not neglect a boy of outstanding talent, as I understand from the testimony of many, and a fellow countryman of yours, if it can be done in any way. He was supported here by our people for some time; but now the situation is such that he can no longer comfortably stay with his parents, his stepmother and stepfather. You will make an effort to help him wherever possible; it is unworthy if such a suitable talent is not cultivated. Amerbach and some others have asked me to request this of you and the other brothers.
Farewell in the Lord Christ, who keeps us in His holy will. Amen.
